arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ بِرَحْمَتِكَ الَّتِي وَسِعَتْ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ
وَبِقُوَّتِكَ الَّتِي قَهَرْتَ بِهَا كُلَّ شَيْءٍ
وَبِجَبَرُوتِكَ الَّتِي غَلَبْتَ بِهَا كُلَّ شَيْءٍ
وَبِعِزَّتِكَ الَّتِي لَا يَقُومُ لَهَا شَيْءٌ
وَبِوَجْهِكَ الْبَاقِي بَعْدَ فَنَاءِ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ
وَبِأَسْمَائِكَ الَّتِي مَلَأَتْ أَرْكَانَ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ
وَبِنُورِ وَجْهِكَ الَّذِي أَضَاءَ لَهُ كُلُّ شَيْءٍ
اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِيَ الذُّنُوبَ الَّتِي تَهْتِكُ الْعِصَمَ
اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِيَ الذُّنُوبَ الَّتِي تُنْزِلُ النِّقَمَ
اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِيَ الذُّنُوبَ الَّتِي تُغَيِّرُ النِّعَمَ
اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِيَ الذُّنُوبَ الَّتِي تَحْبِسُ الدُّعَاءَ
اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِيَ الذُّنُوبَ الَّتِي تُنْزِلُ الْبَلَاءَ
اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي كُلَّ ذَنْبٍ أَذْنَبْتُهُ
وَ أَسْأَلُكَ بِجُودِكَ أَنْ تُدْنِيَنِي مِنْ قُرْبِكَ
اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ سُؤَالَ خَاضِعٍ مُتَذَلِّلٍ خَاشِعٍ
اللَّهُمَّ وَ أَسْأَلُكَ سُؤَالَ مَنِ اشْتَدَّتْ فَاقَتُهُ
وَ أَنْزَلَ بِكَ عِنْدَ الشَّدَائِدِ حَاجَتَهُ
اللَّهُمَّ عَظُمَ سُلْطَانُكَ وَ عَلَا مَكَانُكَ
وَ لَا يُمْكِنُ الْفِرَارُ مِنْ حُكُومَتِكَ
وَ لَا لِشَيْءٍ مِنْ عَمَلِيَ الْقَبِيحِ بِالْحَسَنِ مُبَدِّلاً غَيْرَكَ
وَ سَكَنْتُ إِلَى قَدِيمِ ذِكْرِكَ لِي وَ مَنِّكَ عَلَيَّ
اللَّهُمَّ مَوْلَايَ كَمْ مِنْ قَبِيحٍ سَتَرْتَهُ
وَ كَمْ مِنْ فَادِحٍ مِنَ الْبَلَاءِ أَقَلْتَهُ
وَ كَمْ مِنْ ثَنَاءٍ جَمِيلٍ لَسْتُ أَهْلاً لَهُ نَشَرْتَهُ
وَ حَبَسَنِي عَنْ نَفْعِي بُعْدُ أَمَلِي
يَا سَيِّدِي فَأَسْأَلُكَ بِعِزَّتِكَ أَنْ لَا يَحْجُبَ عَنْكَ دُعَائِي سُوءُ عَمَلِي وَ فِعَالِي
وَ لَا تَفْضَحْنِي بِخَفِيِّ مَا اطَّلَعْتَ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ سِرِّي
وَ لَا تُعَاجِلْنِي بِالْعُقُوبَةِ عَلَى مَا عَمِلْتُهُ فِي خَلَوَاتِي
وَ كُنِ اللَّهُمَّ بِعِزَّتِكَ لِي فِي كُلِّ الْأَحْوَالِ رَءُوفاً
وَ عَلَيَّ فِي جَمِيعِ الْأُمُورِ عَطُوفاً
إِلَهِي وَ رَبِّي مَنْ لِي غَيْرُكَ
أَسْأَلُهُ كَشْفَ ضُرِّي وَ النَّظَرَ فِي أَمْرِي
إِلَهِي وَ مَوْلَايَ أَجْرَيْتَ عَلَيَّ حُكْماً اتَّبَعْتُ فِيهِ هَوَى نَفْسِي
وَ لَمْ أَحْتَرِسْ فِيهِ مِنْ تَزْيِينِ عَدُوِّي
فَغَرَّنِي بِمَا أَهْوَى وَ أَسْعَدَهُ عَلَى ذَلِكَ الْقَضَاءُ
فَتَجَاوَزْتُ بِمَا جَرَى عَلَيَّ مِنْ ذَلِكَ بَعْضَ حُدُودِكَ
فَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ عَلَيَّ فِي جَمِيعِ ذَلِكَ
وَ لَا حُجَّةَ لِي فِيمَا جَرَى عَلَيَّ فِيهِ قَضَاؤُكَ
وَ قَدْ أَتَيْتُكَ يَا إِلَهِي بَعْدَ تَقْصِيرِي وَ إِسْرَافِي عَلَى نَفْسِي
مُعْتَذِراً نَادِماً مُنْكَسِراً مُسْتَقِيلاً مُسْتَغْفِراً مُنِيباً مُقِرّاً مُذْعِناً مُعْتَرِفاً
لَا أَجِدُ مَفَرّاً مِمَّا كَانَ مِنّي
وَ لَا مَفْزَعاً أَتَوَجَّهُ إِلَيْهِ فِي أَمْرِي
غَيْرَ قَبُولِكَ عُذْرِي وَ إِدْخَالِكَ إِيَّايَ فِي سَعَةِ رَحْمَتِكَ
يَا مَنْ بَدَأَ خَلْقِي وَ ذِكْرِي وَ تَرْبِيَتِي وَ بِرِّي وَ تَغْذِيَتِي
هَبْنِي لِابْتِدَاءِ كَرَمِكَ وَ سَالِفِ بِرِّكَ بِي
يَا إِلَهِي وَ سَيِّدِي وَ رَبِّي
وَ بَعْدَمَا انْطَوَى عَلَيْهِ قَلْبِي مِنْ مَعْرِفَتِكَ
وَ لَهِجَ بِهِ لِسَانِي مِنْ ذِكْرِكَ
وَ بَعْدَ صِدْقِ اعْتِرَافِي وَ دُعَائِي خَاضِعاً لِرُبُوبِيَّتِكَ
هَيْهَاتَ أَنْتَ أَكْرَمُ مِنْ أَنْ تُضَيِّعَ مَنْ رَبَّيْتَهُ
أَوْ تُسَلِّمَ إِلَى الْبَلَاءِ مَنْ كَفَيْتَهُ وَ رَحِمْتَهُ
وَ لَيْتَ شِعْرِي يَا سَيِّدِي وَ إِلَهِي وَ مَوْلَايَ
أَتُسَلِّطُ النَّارَ عَلَى وُجُوهٍ خَرَّتْ لِعَظَمَتِكَ سَاجِدَةً
وَ عَلَى أَلْسُنٍ نَطَقَتْ بِتَوْحِيدِكَ صَادِقَةً وَ بِشُكْرِكَ مَادِحَةً
وَ عَلَى قُلُوبٍ اعْتَرَفَتْ بِإِلَهِيَّتِكَ مُحَقِّقَةً
وَ عَلَى ضَمَائِرَ حَوَتْ مِنَ الْعِلْمِ بِكَ حَتَّى صَارَتْ خَاشِعَةً
وَ عَلَى جَوَارِحَ سَعَتْ إِلَى أَوْطَانِ تَعَبُّدِكَ طَائِعَةً
وَ أَنْتَ تَعْلَمُ ضَعْفِي عَنْ قَلِيلٍ مِنْ بَلَاءِ الدُّنْيَا وَ عُقُوبَاتِهَا
وَ مَا يَجْرِي فِيهَا مِنَ الْمَكَارِهِ عَلَى أَهْلِهَا
عَلَى أَنَّ ذَلِكَ بَلَاءٌ وَ مَكْرُوهٌ قَلِيلٌ مَكْثُهُ، يَسِيرٌ بَقَاؤُهُ، قَصِيرٌ مُدَّتُهُ
فَكَيْفَ احْتِمَالِي لِبَلَاءِ الْآخِرَةِ وَ جَلِيلِ وُقُوعِ الْمَكَارِهِ فِيهَا
وَ هُوَ بَلَاءٌ تَطُولُ مُدَّتُهُ وَ يَدُومُ مَقَامُهُ
لِأَنَّهُ لَا يَكُونُ إِلَّا عَنْ غَضَبِكَ وَ انْتِقَامِكَ وَ سَخَطِكَ
وَ هَذَا مَا لَا تَقُومُ لَهُ السَّمَاوَاتُ وَ الْأَرْضُ
يَا سَيِّدِي فَكَيْفَ بِي وَ أَنَا عَبْدُكَ الضَّعِيفُ الذَّلِيلُ الْحَقِيرُ الْمِسْكِينُ الْمُسْتَكِينُ
يَا إِلَهِي وَ رَبِّي وَ سَيِّدِي وَ مَوْلَايَ
وَ لِمَا مِنْهَا أَضِجُّ وَ أَبْكِي
وَ جَمَعْتَ بَيْنِي وَ بَيْنَ أَهْلِ بَلَائِكَ
وَ فَرَّقْتَ بَيْنِي وَ بَيْنَ أَحِبَّائِكَ وَ أَوْلِيَائِكَ
فَهَبْنِي يَا إِلَهِي وَ سَيِّدِي وَ مَوْلَايَ وَ رَبِّي
صَبَرْتُ عَلَى عَذَابِكَ فَكَيْفَ أَصْبِرُ عَلَى فِرَاقِكَ
وَ هَبْنِي صَبَرْتُ عَلَى حَرِّ نَارِكَ فَكَيْفَ أَصْبِرُ عَنِ النَّظَرِ إِلَى كَرَامَتِكَ
أَمْ كَيْفَ أَسْكُنُ فِي النَّارِ وَ رَجَائِي عَفْوُكَ
فَبِعِزَّتِكَ يَا سَيِّدِي وَ مَوْلَايَ أُقْسِمُ صَادِقاً
لَئِنْ تَرَكْتَنِي نَاطِقاً لَأَضِجَّنَّ إِلَيْكَ بَيْنَ أَهْلِهَا ضَجِيجَ الْآمِلِينَ
وَ لَأُنَادِيَنَّكَ أَيْنَ كُنْتَ يَا وَلِيَّ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
أَفَتُرَاكَ سُبْحَانَكَ يَا إِلَهِي وَ بِحَمْدِكَ
تَسْمَعُ فِيهَا صَوْتَ عَبْدٍ مُسْلِمٍ سُجِنَ فِيهَا بِمُخَالَفَتِهِ
وَ حُبِسَ بَيْنَ أَطْبَاقِهَا بِجُرْمِهِ وَ جَرِيرَتِهِ
وَ هُوَ يَضِجُّ إِلَيْكَ ضَجِيجَ مُؤَمِّلٍ لِرَحْمَتِكَ
يَا مَوْلَايَ فَكَيْفَ يَبْقَى فِي الْعَذَابِ وَ هُوَ يَرْجُو مَا سَلَفَ مِنْ حِلْمِكَ
أَمْ كَيْفَ تُؤْلِمُهُ النَّارُ وَ هُوَ يَأْمُلُ فَضْلَكَ وَ رَحْمَتَكَ
أَمْ كَيْفَ يُحْرِقُهُ لَهِيبُهَا وَ أَنْتَ تَسْمَعُ صَوْتَهُ وَ تَرَى مَكَانَهُ
أَمْ كَيْفَ يَشْتَمِلُ عَلَيْهِ زَفِيرُهَا وَ أَنْتَ تَعْلَمُ ضَعْفَهُ
أَمْ كَيْفَ يَتَقَلْقَلُ بَيْنَ أَطْبَاقِهَا وَ أَنْتَ تَعْلَمُ صِدْقَهُ
أَمْ كَيْفَ تَزْجُرُهُ زَبَانِيَتُهَا وَ هُوَ يُنَادِيكَ يَا رَبَّهْ
أَمْ كَيْفَ يَرْجُو فَضْلَكَ فِي عِتْقِهِ مِنْهَا فَتَتْرُكَهُ فِيهَا
وَ لَا مُشْبِهٌ لِمَا عَامَلْتَ بِهِ الْمُوَحِّدِينَ مِنْ بِرِّكَ وَ إِحْسَانِكَ
فَبِالْيَقِينِ أَقْطَعُ لَوْ لَا مَا حَكَمْتَ بِهِ مِنْ تَعْذِيبِ جَاحِدِيكَ
وَ قَضَيْتَ بِهِ مِنْ إِخْلَادِ مُعَانِدِيكَ
لَجَعَلْتَ النَّارَ كُلَّهَا بَرْداً وَ سَلَاماً
وَ مَا كَانَ لِأَحَدٍ فِيهَا مَقَرّاً وَ لَا مُقَاماً
لَكِنَّكَ تَقَدَّسَتْ أَسْمَاؤُكَ أَقْسَمْتَ أَنْ تَمْلَأَهَا مِنَ الْكَافِرِينَ مِنَ الْجِنَّةِ وَ النَّاسِ أَجْمَعِينَ
وَ أَنْتَ جَلَّ ثَنَاؤُكَ قُلْتَ مُبْتَدِئاً وَ تَطَوَّلْتَ بِالْإِنْعَامِ مُتَكَرِّماً
أَ فَمَنْ كَانَ مُؤْمِناً كَمَنْ كَانَ فَاسِقاً لَا يَسْتَوُونَ
وَ بِالْقَضِيَّةِ الَّتِي حَتَمْتَهَا وَ حَكَمْتَهَا
أَنْ تَهَبَ لِي فِي هَذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ وَ فِي هَذِهِ السَّاعَةِ
وَ كُلَّ سَيِّئَةٍ أَمَرْتَ بِإِثْبَاتِهَا الْكِرَامَ الْكَاتِبِينَ
الَّذِينَ وَكَّلْتَهُمْ بِحِفْظِ مَا يَكُونُ مِنِّي
وَ جَعَلْتَهُمْ شُهُوداً عَلَيَّ مَعَ جَوَارِحِي
وَ كُنْتَ أَنْتَ الرَّقِيبَ عَلَيَّ مِنْ وَرَائِهِمْ
وَ أَنْ تُوَفِّرَ حَظِّي مِنْ كُلِّ خَيْرٍ أَنْزَلْتَهُ
يَا رَبِّ يَا رَبِّ يَا رَبِّ
يَا إِلَهِي وَ سَيِّدِي وَ مَوْلَايَ وَ مَالِكَ رِقِّي
يَا رَبِّ يَا رَبِّ يَا رَبِّ
أَسْأَلُكَ بِحَقِّكَ وَ قُدْسِكَ وَ أَعْظَمِ صِفَاتِكَ وَ أَسْمَائِكَ
أَنْ تَجْعَلَ أَوْقَاتِي مِنَ اللَّيْلِ وَ النَّهَارِ بِذِكْرِكَ مَعْمُورَةً
حَتَّى تَكُونَ أَعْمَالِي وَ أَوْرَادِي كُلُّهَا وِرْداً وَاحِداً
يَا سَيِّدِي يَا مَنْ عَلَيْهِ مُعَوَّلِي
يَا رَبِّ يَا رَبِّ يَا رَبِّ
وَ هَبْ لِيَ الْجِدَّ فِي خَشْيَتِكَ
حَتَّى أَسْرَحَ إِلَيْكَ فِي مَيَادِينِ السَّابِقِينَ
وَ أَشْتَاقَ إِلَى قُرْبِكَ فِي الْمُشْتَاقِينَ
وَ أَجْتَمِعَ فِي جِوَارِكَ مَعَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
اللَّهُمَّ وَ مَنْ أَرَادَنِي بِسُوءٍ فَأَرِدْهُ
وَ اجْعَلْنِي مِنْ أَحْسَنِ عَبِيدِكَ نَصِيباً عِنْدَكَ
فِإِنَّهُ لَا يُنَالُ ذَلِكَ إِلَّا بِفَضْلِكَ
وَ إِلَيْكَ يَا رَبِّ مَدَدْتُ يَدِي
وَ لَا تَقْطَعْ مِنْ فَضْلِكَ رَجَائِي
وَ اكْفِنِي شَرَّ الْجِنِّ وَ الْإِنْسِ مِنْ أَعْدَائِي
اغْفِرْ لِمَنْ لَا يَمْلِكُ إِلَّا الدُّعَاءَ
صَلِّ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وَ آلِ مُحَمَّدٍ
وَ افْعَلْ بِي مَا أَنْتَ أَهْلُهُ
وَ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَى رَسُولِهِ وَ الْأَئِمَّةِ الْمَيَامِينِ مِنْ آلِهِ وَ سَلَّمَ تَسْلِيماً كَثِيراً

translation: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful
O Allah, I ask You by Your mercy, which encompasses all things,
and by Your strength, through which You dominate all things,
and toward which all things are humbled,
and before which all things are lowly,
and by Your omnipotence, through which You overwhelm all things,
and by Your might, which nothing can withstand,
and by Your grandeur, which has filled all things,
and by Your authority, which is exalted above all things,
and by Your Face, which endures after the annihilation of all things,
and by Your Names, which have filled the foundations of all things,
and by Your knowledge, which encompasses all things,
and by the light of Your Face, through which all things are illuminated,
O Light! O Holy!
O First of the first!
And O Last of the last!
O Allah, forgive me those sins that tear down safeguards!
O Allah, forgive me those sins that bring down misfortunes!
O Allah, forgive me those sins that alter blessings!
O Allah, forgive me those sins that hold back supplication!
O Allah, forgive me those sins that bring down afflictions!
O Allah, forgive me every sin I have committed,
and every mistake I have made.
O Allah, I draw near to You through Your remembrance,
and I seek Your intercession with Yourself,
and I ask You by Your generosity to bring me nearer to Your presence,
and to inspire me to be grateful to You,
and to prompt me to remember You.
O Allah, I ask You with the asking of a submissive, humble, lowly person,
to pardon me and have mercy on me,
and to make me content and satisfied with Your provision,
and humble in all circumstances.
O Allah, I ask You the asking of one whose poverty is intense,
and who has presented his need to You in times of hardship,
and whose desire for what is with You has become great.
O Allah, Your authority is tremendous and Your station is exalted,
and Your plan is hidden,
and Your command is manifest,
and Your dominance is overpowering,
and Your power is operational,
and it is impossible to escape Your governance.
O Allah, I find no forgiver for my sins,
nor concealer for my ugly deeds,
nor anyone to change my ugly deeds into good deeds, other than You.
There is no god but You.
Glory be to You, and praise be to You.
I have wronged myself,
and I have acted audaciously out of my ignorance,
and I took comfort in Your ancient remembrance of me and Your favor upon me.
O Allah, my Master, how many ugly things You have concealed!
And how many burdensome afflictions You have averted!
And how many stumbles You have prevented!
And how many disliked things You have repelled!
And how much beautiful praise, for which I was unworthy, You have spread!
O Allah, my affliction is immense,
and my bad state is excessive,
and my actions fall short,
and my chains have held me down,
and my lengthy hopes have held me back from my benefit,
and the world with its delusions has deceived me,
and my own soul by its transgression,
and my procrastination.
O my Lord! So I ask You by Your might, that my evil actions and deeds may not veil my supplication from You,
and do not expose me through the hidden things You know of my secrets,
and do not hasten my punishment for what I have done in my privacies
of evil acts and wrongdoings,
and my continuous negligence and ignorance,
and my abundant desires and heedlessness.
And be, O Allah, by Your might, kind to me in all situations,
and compassionate towards me in all matters.
My God and my Lord! Who else do I have but You?
Whom I can ask to remove my adversity and look into my affairs?
My God and my Master! You decreed a ruling upon me in which I followed the desires of my own soul,
and I was not cautious in it against the adornment of my enemy.
So he deceived me with what I desired, and destiny assisted him in that.
Thus, by what transpired upon me in this, I transgressed some of Your boundaries,
and I opposed some of Your commands.
So You have the argument against me in all of that,
and I have no argument in what Your decree executed upon me,
and Your judgment and Your trial have obligated me.
And now I have come to You, O my God, after my shortcomings and my excess against myself,
Apologizing, remorseful, broken, resigning, seeking forgiveness, repenting, acknowledging, submitting, confessing.
I find no escape from what has occurred from me,
nor any refuge to which I can turn in my affairs,
Except Your acceptance of my excuse and Your admitting me into the vastness of Your mercy.
O Allah, so accept my excuse,
and have mercy on the severity of my distress,
and release me from the tightness of my fetters.
O Lord, have mercy on the weakness of my body,
and the thinness of my skin,
and the frailty of my bones.
O You Who initiated my creation, and my remembrance, and my upbringing, and my goodness towards me, and my nourishment!
Grant me [forgiveness] for the sake of Your initial generosity and Your past kindness towards me.
O my God, and my Master, and my Lord!
Do You see Yourself tormenting me with Your fire after my affirmation of Your Oneness,
and after the knowledge of You my heart has embraced,
and the remembrance of You my tongue has constantly uttered,
and the love of You my conscience has held,
and after the sincerity of my confession and my supplication, humble before Your Lordship?
Far be it! You are more generous than to abandon the one You have raised,
or to distance the one You have brought near,
or to drive away the one You have sheltered,
or to hand over to affliction the one You have suffices and shown mercy to.
And would that I knew, O my Master, my God and my Lord!
Will You inflict the Fire upon faces which have fallen down prostrate to Your greatness?
And upon tongues which have spoken Your Oneness sincerely, and Your praise thankfully?
And upon hearts which have acknowledged Your Divinity with conviction?
And upon minds which have contained knowledge of You until they became humble?
And upon limbs which have hastened to the places of Your worship obediently,
and indicated their seeking of Your forgiveness submissively?
This is not the expectation of You!
Nor have we been informed of such, concerning Your grace, from You.
O Generous One! O Lord!
And You know my weakness before a small amount of the afflictions and punishments of this world,
and the disliked things that happen to its inhabitants,
even though that is an affliction and a disliked matter whose stay is short, whose continuation is easy, whose duration is brief.
So how can I endure the affliction of the Hereafter and the great occurrence of disliked things within it?
And it is an affliction whose duration is long, and whose stay is permanent,
and from its people [the suffering] is not lightened,
because it only arises from Your anger, Your vengeance, and Your wrath.
And this is what the heavens and the earth cannot withstand!
O my Master! Then how about me, while I am Your weak, lowly, insignificant, poor, and destitute servant?
O my God, my Lord, my Master, and my Protector!
For which matters shall I complain to You?
And for which of them shall I lament and weep?
For the painful torment and its severity?
Or for the length of the affliction and its duration?
So if You place me in punishments with Your enemies,
and gather me with the people of Your affliction,
and separate me from Your beloved ones and Your friends,
Then suppose, O my God, my Master, my Protector, and my Lord,
I am patient over Your torment, then how can I be patient over separation from You?
And suppose I am patient over the heat of Your fire, then how can I be patient about looking upon Your generosity?
Or how can I dwell in the Fire while my hope is Your pardon?
So by Your might, O my Master and my Protector, I swear truthfully,
if You leave me able to speak, I will surely cry out to You amidst its inhabitants with the crying of the hopeful,
and I will surely scream to You the screams of those crying for help,
and I will surely weep over You the weeping of the bereaved,
and I will surely call You, 'Where are You, O Guardian of the believers?'
O Goal of the hopes of the gnostics!
O Helper of those seeking aid!
O Beloved of the hearts of the truthful!
And O God of the worlds!
Can it be, Glory be to You, O my God, and praise be to You,
that You hear within it [the Fire] the voice of a Muslim servant imprisoned therein for his opposition,
and who has tasted the flavour of its torment for his disobedience,
and confined between its layers for his crime and his sin,
while he cries out to You the cry of one hopeful for Your mercy,
and calls You with the tongue of the people of Your Oneness,
and seeks Your mediation through Your Lordship?
O my Protector! How can he remain in torment while he hopes for what has preceded of Your forbearance?
Or how can the Fire cause him pain while he hopes for Your grace and Your mercy?
Or how can its flame burn him while You hear his voice and see his place?
Or how can its exhalation encompass him while You know his weakness?
Or how can he be tossed about between its layers while You know his truthfulness?
Or how can its guards rebuke him while he calls out to You, 'O my Lord!'?
Or how can he hope for Your grace in freeing him from it, yet You would leave him therein?
Far be it! That is not the expectation of You!
Nor is it known of Your grace!
Nor does it resemble the kindness and beneficence with which You have treated the monotheists!
So with certainty I declare: were it not for what You have decreed regarding the punishment of Your deniers,
and ordained regarding the eternality of Your stubborn opponents,
You would have made the Fire entirely cool and peaceful,
and there would not have been in it a place of settlement nor residence for anyone.
But You - sanctified are Your Names - have sworn to fill it with the disbelievers from among the jinn and mankind altogether,
and to make the stubborn opponents reside eternally therein.
And You - magnificent is Your praise - said initially, and bestowed favor generously:
'Is one who was a believer like one who was defiantly disobedient? They are not equal.' (Quran 32:18)
My God and my Master!
So I ask You by the power which You have ordained,
and by the decree which You have determined and ruled,
and You have overcome the one upon whom You have executed it,
that You grant me, in this night and in this hour,
[forgiveness for] every offense I have committed,
and every sin I have perpetrated,
and every ugly deed I have concealed,
and every ignorance I have acted upon,
whether I hid it or declared it,
whether I concealed it or revealed it,
and every evil deed which You commanded the noble scribes [angels] to record,
whom You have assigned to preserve what proceeds from me,
and You made them witnesses over me along with my own limbs,
and You Yourself were the Watcher over me from behind them,
and the Witness to what was hidden from them,
but which You hid through Your mercy,
and concealed through Your grace.
And [I ask] that You make abundant my share of every good You send down,
or kindness You bestow,
or righteousness You spread,
or provision You expand,
or sin You forgive,
or error You conceal.
O Lord! O Lord! O Lord!
O my God, my Master, my Protector, and Owner of my bondage!
O He in Whose hand is my forelock!
O He Who knows my affliction and my poverty!
O He Who is aware of my destitution and my need!
O Lord! O Lord! O Lord!
I ask You by Your truth, Your holiness, and the greatest of Your attributes and Your names,
that You make my times of the night and the day occupied with Your remembrance,
and connected to Your service,
and my deeds acceptable to You,
so that my deeds and my litanies all become one single litany,
and my state in Your service be perpetual.
O my Master! O He upon Whom is my reliance!
O He to Whom I complain of my states!
O Lord! O Lord! O Lord!
Strengthen my limbs for Your service,
and make firm my ribs [heart/determination] upon resolution,
and grant me seriousness in fearing You,
and continuity in connection with Your service,
so that I may race towards You in the fields of the foremost,
and hasten towards You among the prominent,
and yearn for Your nearness among the yearning,
and draw near to You the nearness of the sincere,
and fear You the fear of the certain,
and gather in Your vicinity with the believers.
O Allah, whoever intends evil for me, intend [it] for him!
And whoever plots against me, plot against him!
And make me among Your servants with the best portion near You,
and the nearest of them in station to You,
and the most special of them in closeness before You.
For indeed, that cannot be attained except through Your grace.
And be generous to me with Your generosity,
and incline towards me with Your glory,
and protect me with Your mercy.
And make my tongue constantly occupied with Your remembrance,
and my heart enthralled with Your love.
And favor me with Your excellent response,
and pardon my stumble,
and forgive my slip.
For indeed, You have ordained upon Your servants Your worship,
and commanded them to supplicate to You,
and You have guaranteed them the response.
So towards You, O Lord, I have turned my face,
and towards You, O Lord, I have stretched out my hand.
So by Your might, respond to my supplication,
and make me attain my desires,
and do not cut off my hope from Your grace,
and protect me from the evil of the jinn and humans among my enemies.
O You swift to be pleased!
Forgive the one who possesses nothing but supplication,
for You are indeed Doer of what You will.
O He Whose Name is a remedy,
and Whose remembrance is a cure,
and obedience to Whom is richness!
Have mercy upon the one whose capital is hope,
and whose weapon is weeping!
O Bestower of bounties!
O Repeller of misfortunes!
O Light of those lonely in the darkness!
O Knower Who is not taught!
Bless Muhammad and the progeny of Muhammad,
and do with me what You are worthy of.
And may Allah bless His Messenger and the blessed Imams from his progeny, and grant them abundant peace.
